content.text: The code repository located at /tmp/workdir/preprocess_strands_20260128/rest-schemagen is currently written in Java 8. Please migrate the entire codebase to Java 17.

reasoningText.text:
Let me start by exploring the repository structure to understand the codebase and then perform the migration from Java 8 to Java 17.

I'll need to:
1. First, explore the repository structure
2. Check the pom.xml file to see the current Java version configuration
3. Update the Java version to 17 in the pom.xml
4. Run mvn clean verify to see if there are any issues
5. Fix any compatibility issues that arise

Let's begin by viewing the repository structure.

Perfect! I can see the issue. The `javax.xml.bind` package was removed from the JDK in Java 11 and is not available in Java 17. This is a common issue when migrating from Java 8 to Java 17. Let me check the file that's causing the issue:
I need to add the JAXB dependency to the pom.xml file. The JAXB API was removed from Java 11 onwards and needs to be added as an external dependency. Let me add it:

			<artifactId>jsr305</artifactId>
			<version>3.0.2</version>
		</dependency>
New string: 		<dependency>
			<groupId>com.google.code.findbugs</groupId>
			<artifactId>jsr305</artifactId>
			<version>3.0.2</version>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>

			<artifactId>jakarta.xml.bind-api</artifactId>
			<version>4.0.2</version>
		</dependency>
		<dependency>
			<groupId>org.glassfish.jaxb</groupId>
			<artifactId>jaxb-runtime</artifactId>
			<version>4.0.5</version>
			<scope>runtime</scope>
		</dependency>
